alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Marion; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:07AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Searcy, central Newton, Marion, southeastern Boone and northwestern Baxter Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 807 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Myrtle to near Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrison... Bull Shoals... Yellville... Jasper... Gassville... Flippin... Lakeview in Baxter County... Bergman... Western Grove... Pyatt... Valley Springs... Arkawana... Dugger... Olvey... Carver... Erbie... Lakeway... Bull Shoals State Park... Winington... Clark Hill... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM CDT for north central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until noon CDT for north central Arkansas.
